summary: the fast-casual chain will work with the postmates app to begin offering delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities . the app hires independent contractors who drive their own cars in a similar model to uber taxis . chipotle is thought to have turned down previous offers of collaboration with third-party delivery services .

aspect: 1. Mexican restaurant Chipotle partners with Postmates app to offer delivery in 67 cities, adding a 9% service charge.
2. Chipotle has rejected previous delivery offers but now partners with Postmates.
3. Chipotle joins a growing list of franchises seeking to cash in on the $70B delivery market, including Starbucks and Taco Bell.
explain: Chipotle, a fast-casual chain Mexican restaurant, partners with Postmates app for delivery services in 67 cities, introducing a 9% service charge.
Chipotle has initially refused collaboration with third-party delivery services but now chose to work with Postmates, an app that utilizes independent contractors for delivery.

Chipotle is among the latest fast-casual chains to join the delivery service market, aiming to capitalize on the booming $70B delivery industry, joining well-established brands like Starbucks and Taco Bell.
